intro: Scleranthus laricifolius, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Scleranthus laricifolius thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous or high-altitude environments.
